definition: cookie (loanword via Cantonese 曲奇 kuk1 kei4)

sentences.english: Of course, lots of cookies means some of them must be put away for later days.
sentences.chinese: 當然，大量的曲奇就意味着有一些會被留着以後再喫。

sentences.english: There his wife was baking chocolate chip cookies.
sentences.chinese: 他老伴正在做巧克力塊曲奇。

sentences.english: Take a cookie, for example. Butter comes from cows and cows cost money.
sentences.chinese: 以曲奇爲例子，黃油來自奶牛，而奶牛需要用錢。

sentences.english: We pigged out on potato chips and cookies until our bellies ached.
sentences.chinese: 大喫薯條和曲奇，喫到肚子撐到痛爲止。

sentences.english: How full is the cookie jar?
sentences.chinese: 曲奇餅乾的罐子有多滿？

sentences.english: These cookies are made with sugar and cinnamon.
sentences.chinese: 這些曲奇餅的材料包括糖及玉桂粉。

sentences.english: We can thank God for Bavarian sugar cookies.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以感謝上帝的巴伐利亞糖曲奇。

sentences.english: They want to set a record by making Buffalo's largest cookie.
sentences.chinese: 他們想打破巴甫洛最大的曲奇的紀錄。

sentences.english: Many kitchens have a cookie jar for that purpose.
sentences.chinese: 因此許多家裏的廚房會有曲奇罐頭。

sentences.english: Coffee cookie with walnut, not too sweet, very crunchy.
sentences.chinese: 加了核桃的咖啡曲奇，味道不太甜，但非常鬆脆。

sentences.english: Though we slept early last night, we woke up at six, crazy!
sentences.chinese: 早前爸爸經學校訂購的曲奇，今天終於收到了。

sentences.english: Take that cookie. Vegetable fats are cheaper and are used in place of butter.
sentences.chinese: 以曲奇爲例子，植物油便宜，可用於代替黃油。

sentences.english: Chocolate chip cookies? You ate them all. There's nothing left.
sentences.chinese: 朱古力曲奇餅？你全喫掉了，什麼都沒剩下。

sentences.english: Adding baking soda to the batter help to hold the swirls on the cookies.
sentences.chinese: 加入梳打粉，有助令曲奇上的花紋更凸出。

definition: macaron, French pastry with a soft filling sandwiched between the meringue-based cookie shells (loanword)
